thread.title: Why Jacob Rees-Mogg was 5% away from a life of silence in a Leicestershire Monastery

author: Dan Martin
title: Why Jacob Rees-Mogg was 5% away from a life of silence in a Leicestershire Monastery
text:
Get Daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Leicestershire might have gained another MP - sort of - had the EU referendum swung the other way. 
Leading Brexiteer Jacob Rees-Mogg has joked that he would have retired to a ‘Trappist Monastery’ in the county had the UK voted to remain in the European Union in 2016. 
In the end the Leave campaign won by 52 per cent to 48 per cent. 
He did not specify exactly where he had in mind but the county has a monastery - Mount St Bernard Abbey near Whitwick - where some of the monks have taken a vow of silence. 
The Tory MP for North East Somerset made the remark today during a speech at a Leave Means Leave event organised to mark a year from when Britain is poised to quit the EU. 
Mr Rees-Mogg also described people trying to derail Brexit as ‘cave dwellers’ adding that reneging on the referendum result would be a ‘national humiliation’ worse than the Suez crisis. Read More
